channel.title: Animals - Digg
channel.description: Animals on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: A Runaway Pig Was Chased By Stamford Police Officers For 45 Minutes, Until It Was Captured. Here Are The Highlights
item.description: At one point, a police officer proclaimed it "a stand-off."

item.title: Here's A Rare Glimpse At A Snow Leopard Shrieking Out Into The Void
item.description: The White Lion Foundation released an extraordinary, rare video of a snow leopard making a shriek caught on camera in the mountains of northern Pakistan.
item.kicker: MORE A SCREAM THAN A ROAR

item.title: The Uplifting Tale Of These Tiny Island Foxes, Nearly Wiped Out By Disaster
item.description: Earth Day began after a catastrophe off California. Leadership and science restored nature and hope through years of despair and controversy.

item.title: Watch This American Woodcock And Its Babies Do Their Trademark Funky Walk
item.description: The American Woodcock's remarkably bouncy walk helps it stir up worms in the dirt and it's a terrific wonder to behold — especially when its younglings are getting the hang of the motion.

item.title: Man Tries To Scare Mouse From Under Refrigerator, Gets Some Instant Karma
item.description: A Russian man tried to scare a mouse but ended up getting the tables turned on him.

item.title: The 'Tiger King' Informant Was My Coworker At PetCo
item.description: I worked at PetCo for a whole year when I was 17 and one day my shift fatefully overlapped with James Garretson. Yes, he let me pet a lion. Yes, I was stoned the whole time.
item.kicker: KEEP YOUR ENEMIES CLOSE, CO-WORKERS CLOSER

item.title: Duck Chases Owner Only To Act All Nonchalant When Owner Realizes What It's Doing
item.description: Here's what it looks like when a duck tries to play hard-to-get.

item.title: Woman Shocked To Find A Groundhog Scarfing Down A Pizza Outside Her Door
item.description: Kristin Chalela Bagnell had the shock of a lifetime when she, and her two dogs, noticed a large rodent munching on a pizza(!), outside her sliding glass door.

item.title: Icebox Full Of Live Crabs Breaks Open On Airport Luggage Carousel, All Hell Breaks Loose
item.description: Why would someone ship a box of live crabs in a baggage hold? Your guess is as good as ours.

item.title: Massive Wild Animals Wander Russian Streets In These Surreal Composites By Vadim Solovyov
item.description: Seeing a raccoon washing its paws in the rivers of Saint Petersburg or an octopus tumbling out of a city bus would be a startling sight for most city dwellers.

item.title: Here's The Weird Thing That Causes The Smell of Spring
item.description: You know the scent. Now meet the source.
item.kicker: WISH WE DIDN'T KNOW THIS NOW

item.title: How Monkeys, Ferrets And Horses Are Helping Scientists Fight COVID-19
item.description: Mice, monkeys, cats, dogs, ferrets, chickens and even horses are critical for coronavirus research.

item.title: These Ducklings Were Lost And Couldn't Find Their Mothers, So The Houston Police Stepped In To Escort Them
item.description: Those are some lucky ducklings.

item.title: This Video Of A New Jersey Cowboy Showing Off His Fancy Horsemanship Is The Most Delightful Video You'll Watch Today
item.description: It's not every day that you see this at the intersection.

item.title: Coronavirus Closure Returns Yosemite To The Animals
item.description: The deer, bobcats, coyotes and bears no longer have to deal with the hordes of camera-toting tourist vying to capture nature. They now roam unfettered.
item.kicker: WE ARE THE — ACTUALLY, THE VIRUS IS THE VIRUS

item.title: Watch A Swamp Rabbit From Missouri Caught On Camera Swimming For The First Time
item.description: Watch these little-known creatures swimming in the swamps on Missouri.

item.title: Man Has Hilarious Reaction To Giant 'Donald Trump Bird' Landing On His Car
item.description: A cattle egret was spotted standing on top of an unsuspecting Florida man's car, prompting him to make a spot-on observation.

item.title: 'Tiger King' Is A Wild Ride. And Largely Misleading
item.description: There are some fundamental differences between the facilities and owners that the series leaves out.

item.title: Can Pets Contract The Coronavirus? What About The Tiger?
item.description: Here's what to do if your cat starts coughing.

item.title: Bird Rehabber Teaches European Starling To Speak Words, And It's Pretty Wild
item.description: European starlings are astonishingly good at mimicking sounds. This intrepid wildlife rehabber taught it to say words related to its introduction to North America.

item.title: Footprints Of Extraction
item.description: The Svalbard Archipelago was uninhabited until humans came searching for resources. A historian follows their tracks.
item.kicker: BETWEEN NORWAY AND THE NORTH POLE

item.title: Veterinary Scientist Hailed For Faroe Islands' Lack Of COVID-19 Deaths
item.description: Debes Christiansen adapted his salmon-testing lab to test for disease among humans.

item.title: Here's A Video Of Kittens Being Released Inside The Georgia Aquarium
item.description: With the aquarium closed, the Atlanta Humane Society let a litter of kittens wander the grounds.

item.title: Man Has Hilarious, Totally Effective And Not Nonsensical Warning To Cows To Not Touch His Fence Post
item.description: Well, there's no need to have a cow about this.

item.title: Hawks' Forbidden Love Results In A Rare Hybrid
item.description: She was a common black hawk. He was a red-shouldered hawk. They weren't in the same genus, let alone the same species, and they normally don't even live in the same part of the continent. But in a strange twist of fate, none of that mattered: It was love at first screech.

item.title: The Most-Watched Show In America Is A Moral Failure
item.description: Netflix's "Tiger King" is the apotheosis of extreme storytelling: the more unfathomable and ethically dubious, the better.

item.title: The Woods Hole Lab Where Mysteries Of The Deep Are Solved
item.description: Nervous sharks, flight-risk octopuses and fish that walk are just a few of Dave Remsen's cases.

item.title: Here's A 150-Foot Long Silly String-Like Creature Scientists Discovered Near Australia
item.description: Researchers from the Schmidt Ocean Institute captured footage of a 150-foot long siphonophore off the western coast of Australia. Their R/V Falkor, a oceanographic research vessel, was exploring deep sea canyons, when it discovered the unusually large underwater creature.

item.title: The Way Starfish Walk Is Absolutely Mesmerizing
item.description: This striking video of a starfish walking along on the surface of an aquarium wall demonstrates how the animal moves using hundreds of tube feet.

item.title: Well, At Least The Pandas Are Having A Nice Time
item.description: For the first time in more than a decade, two giant pandas named Ying Ying and Le Le, who reside at Ocean Park in Hong Kong, have mated naturally.

item.title: AI Reveals That Mice's Faces Express A Range Of Emotions, Just Like Humans
item.description: The research will help scientists understand how our brains process emotions.

item.title: Whale Sharks May Live Up To A Century, Cold War Bomb Dating Reveals
item.description: The biggest fish in the sea is more vulnerable to extinction than thought, a new study finds.

item.title: What We Know About The Tiger With COVID-19, And How The Disease Affects Other Animals
item.description: A tiger at the Bronx Zoo has tested positive for the coronavirus — joining a number of other animals around the world with COVID-19.
item.kicker: THESE THINGS WERE NEVER SUPPOSED TO COMBINE

item.title: Apparently Walruses Can Whistle, And It's Weird As Heck
item.description: Seeing a walrus whistle like a human really drives home just how weird looking — and strangely like humans — walruses are.
item.kicker: IMAGINE HEARING THAT IN THE WILD

item.title: Fox Steals Phone While It's Recording, And The Footage Is Extremely Cute
item.description: Dixie the fox is a cinematographer first, a pilferer second.

item.title: Meet The Xenobots, Virtual Creatures Brought To Life
item.description: Computer scientists and biologists have teamed up to make a new class of living robotics that challenge the boundary between digital and biological.

item.title: The Pandemic Is Turning The Natural World Upside Down
item.description: Widespread social-distancing measures have produced some jarring effects across land, air and sea.

item.title: Squirrel Hangs On For Dear Life As Bird Feeder Starts Spinning Uncontrollably
item.description: A poor squirrel got caught on a spinning bird feeder as a homeowner watched in glee.

item.title: The Curious Penguins Are Back, And This Time They Meet A Giant Penguin Model
item.description: Also, they continue to be extremely cute and the only balm we have in this pandemic.

item.title: Scientists Name New Species After Its Belly Full Of Plastic
item.description: Plastic pollution reaches new depths — and new guts.

item.title: This Twitter Thread Of Animals That Look Like PokÃ©mon Might Be The Most Delightful Thing You See Today
item.description: Rebecca Helm, a biology professor at the University of North Carolina Asheville who specializes in jellyfish, put together an eye-popping Twitter thread of real world animals that she deemed "should be Pokemon."

item.title: Let's Think Twice About 'Tiger King'
item.description: Netflix's hit show invites us to gawk at its ridiculousness.

item.title: The Coronavirus Lockdown Is A Threat For Many Animals, Not A Blessing
item.description: You may have seen recent videos of goats roaming an empty town. But for more vulnerable species, like rhinos, this shutdown poses a great danger.

item.title: Coronavirus Diaries: Screw It, We Got A Dog
item.description: We had to act quickly.

item.title: Oceans Can Be Restored To Former Glory Within 30 Years, Say Scientists
item.description: Major review reports recovery of marine life, but a redoubling of efforts is still needed.

item.title: Orangutan Sees Her Caretakers Washing Their Hands All The Time Now, So She Adorably Copies Them
item.description: Sandra the orangutan is too precious for our world.

item.title: Corgi Realizes A Rock Is A Turtle And Has Its World Rocked
item.description: Turbo the corgi learned about the existence of turtles in the most shocking way.

item.title: Here's An Intense, Territorial Fight Between Two Tigers Caught On Camera
item.description: Two full-grown tigers were caught on camera in central India fighting over territory according to a post by Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Parveen Kaswan.
item.kicker: YOU GOTTA LISTEN TO THE ROAR

item.title: How Do Predators Learn To Avoid The Colors And Patterns Of Poisonous Prey?
item.description: Using video games, scientists show it has to do with the environment and network of prey available.

item.title: Extremely Helpful Bear Fixes Fallen Safety Cone
item.description: Wildlife photographer Michael Mauro captured a bear in Denali National Park making a considerate adjustment to a traffic cone.
